pros: Good money and easy job
cons: redundancies in terms of meetings and rounds.

review_title: Better than no job at all
pros: Department colleagues were great, close to Austin.
cons: Administration dismissive and inept, increased health insurance premiums faster than salaries. Senior admin given higher percent raises than faculty.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Austin, TX
pros: Great heath insurance Free tuition for children Good location Nice coworkers
cons: Morale is low as work from home is not advocated Low salary No room for advancement

pros: A very family first organization
cons: Pay is less than what similar roles in community are paid.

pros: Friendly and collegial faculty and staff.
cons: Faculty salaries are below the national average; they are essentially poverty wages given inflation and the rise in cost of living in Central Texas.

review_title: Lower on the pay scale and really expensive yet crappy benefits
pros: Good colleagues and a nice location.
cons: Horrible administration at the top. Health insurance for a family runs you over $1,000 per month and for access to some pretty bad physicians. Horrible dental plan. Mosts of us chose a spouse's insurance if we could since it was always better.

pros: Great people to work with and good benefits.
cons: Salaries are on the lower end - not competitive for the level of education most employees bring to the university.

pros: Excellent skill building and professional development opportunities!!
cons: Poor pay. Struggled to keep employees in the student life devision which put more work on student worker’s plates, and on our supervisors.

pros: Great community of fellow RAs and administrative staff, collaborative environment.
cons: Shifts are assigned by Head RA, schedule changes month to month in terms of RA on Duty shifts.

pros:
Free Tuition for you and your children 
Gym to use
Nice campus atmosphere 
Good management 
Good and reasonably priced health insurance
cons:
Low salary
No room for growth

pros:
Simple job
Good on a resume
cons:
Almost no assistance for room and board
Low salaries

job_title: Business Data Analyst in Austin, TX
pros: Extremely supportive and collegial across every level of the administration
cons: To be honest, can't find any cons.

pros: Great university with a strong historical foundation and nuanced educational approach
cons: Bureaucratic administration that lacks the vision to grow the school

pros: Some jobs are higher paying here but I love that I can do HW while I work :)
cons: The only con is that there is a limit to how much you can work! But since students are so busy that’s not a problem

review_title: Great colleagues but horrible administration  previously
pros: Great colleagues and easy distance to Austin.
cons: Horrible administration at the time.

job_title: Student Activities Officer in Georgetown, TX
pros: Good experience as a student that helped get my foot in the door after college.
cons: It is not full time employment

job_title: IT Student Worker in Georgetown, TX
pros:
Easy scheduling.
Basically a work-learn job.
cons: None that I can really think of.

pros:
Campus is beautiful, some staff are extremely helpful in an otherwise uppity environment. 

You can eat on campus for $5.50 a meal. Thanksgiving and Christmas holidays are paid time off.
cons: It’s ironic that Southwestern’s mascot is a pirate, because this organization is a sinking ship. Most of my time here has been reactive, and I can’t plan ahead for time with family, even on a day to day basis, because of the unpredictable schedule. There’s no compensation or overtime here, and depending on the job, it’s not uncommon that you’ll find yourself working for free for 10-20 hours a week, including weekend time. If you come in early to meet the demands of the job, do not expect to leave earlier in the day, accordingly. Ensure that the benefits that you pay for are, in fact, active, as some people have been paying into benefits that were inactive at no fault of the employee. This is dangerous incompetence, especially if you have a family member in serious need of care.

pros:
Small campus, easy to get to know everyone
Everyone is relatively friendly and easy to talk too
State job so benefits are good
cons:
No real benefits...they are doing away with Fridays off in July and allowing employees to randomly choose days off. 
No real growth opportunity - the campus is so small that many people are in their positions for long periods of time
No focus or concern with social issues - even if the issues don't affect all the students on campus, there are still some portions of the population being affected and that should be addressed
Cheap (1-ply) toilet tissue
Salaries below national average
No true professional development
Technologically behind

review_title: A great place to work in a calm, smart atmosphere
pros: Working on a campus with bright students and dedicated faculty makes every day a joy. The campus is lovely and the life/work balance is excellent. Employees are offered good benefits and many "free" days off. Employees actually start with almost a month of time off with pay due to the academic schedule
cons: On a college campus, the staff are at the end of the food chain. We are servants of the facility and the high level of "looking to be offended" people is high. You must always watch your step as to not offend anyone...definately NOT the "real world" if you are not used to working in Higher Ed.

pros:
-Staff is pleasant and likes working with students.
-Some amount of flexibility in emergencies.
-They understand the stress that students can be put under
-Work schedule can be tailored to fit  into classes if shifts are available.
-If a student had a job the previous year/semester they are likely to be given first pick of shifts if they want that position again
-It can be a bit competitive to get a position, but introducing yourself to the supervisor and letting them know you're interested in the job is an almost guaranteed way to get onto the short list.
cons:
-The Direct Deposit method for payment can be a bit complicated.
-Student positions pay minimum wage, but this is expected.

review_title: Like being a part of a family. (Which means it comes with the disfunction.)
pros: work-life balance; benefits; supportive colleagues; intellectual community
cons: limited upward mobility; low pay; poor internal communations

pros: Friendly people, flexible hours with class schedule, can often do homework during shift
cons: Pay is close to minimum wage, so not reasonable for those who rely on earnings

pros:
Variety of events for students to participate in or attend
Close to Austin
cons:
Very small, thus difficult to fit in
Certain campus culture that is designed for a specific student and does not have the universal welcoming feel that larger schools offer

pros: Very flexible with assigning hours
cons: Pay is not much above minimum
